alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 1:38PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorms have dissipated. However, between 1 to 2 inches of rainfall has fallen over this area which will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 215 PM EDT for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Miami Gardens, Dania Beach, Cooper City, West Park, Miramar Parkway And University Drive, Royal Palm Ranches, Chambers Estates, Oak Point, Estates Of Fort Lauderdale, Ravenswood Estates, Country Club, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood International Airport, Pembroke Park and Downtown Davie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
